author: felixfbecker
body:
- I have been trying to write a set of C# cmdlets and package them up in a module for PowershellGallery.
- I followed the documentation for writing Cmdlets and am compiling it with `dotnet build`.
- I generated a module manifest .psd1 and referenced the output DLL in `RequiredAssemblies`.
- When I run `Import-Module my.psd1`, I get no error, but invoking any of the cmdlets fails with an error that the cmdlet is not recognized. `Get-Module` shows that the module was loaded but `ExportedCommands` is empty.

I don't know if this is a bug in PowerShell or I am doing something wrong, but this is a very frustrating dev experience. If I am doing something wrong, I would expect some kind of error message or better documentation on what needs to be done to hook up C# cmdlets to Powershell.

Here's the repository to reproduce: https://github.com/felixfbecker/ps-kubectl

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Is this work for you - Jason Shirk's "specify the dll as your RootModule"?

comments.author: felixfbecker
comments.body:
After getting help on Gitter I got it to work by setting the DLL as the RootModule.

I still strongly believe there should be an error if `Import-Module` is called on a module manifest without `RootModule`, or `Test-ModuleManifest`.

It would be nice if this was also mentioned in the tutorial for [writing Cmdlets in C#](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd878294(v=vs.85).aspx). It is obvious for normal modules, but for C# I assumed I had to add it to `RequiredAssemblies`.
